prompt: What type of marine mammal can reach a weight of more than six tons?
icl_complete: The marine mammal that can reach a weight of more than six tons is the orca, also known as the killer whale (Orcinus orca). Orcas are the largest members of the dolphin family and are known for their distinctive black and white coloring. They are apex predators, meaning they are at the top of their food chain, and they can be found in oceans around the world. The largest male orcas can weigh up to ten tons and reach lengths of up to 32 feet (9.7 meters).
advise: To better follow the feedback, double-check the specific details and ensure the information provided is precise and accurate. Confirm which marine mammals exceed the weight threshold mentioned in the query to avoid generalizations or inaccuracies.
